26100:
Build Trade Cart (‹cost›)
Trade unit used for generating gold at another player's Market. To trade, click the Trade Cart then right-click another player's Market. Will return with gold to your Market.
Upgrades: speed (Market); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26121:
Create Villager (‹cost›)
Gathers resources. Builds and repairs buildings. Also repairs Ships and Siege Weapons.
Upgrades: HP, armor, efficiency (Town Center); wood resource-gathering (Lumber Camp); stone, gold resource-gathering (Mining Camp); build speed (University); attack (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26154:
Build Guard Tower (‹cost›)
Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. Ranged Soldiers. Weak vs. units at close range, especially rams.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); attack, range (Blacksmith); attack, HP, armor, ship attack; to Keep (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26185:
Build Gate (‹cost›)
Sturdy stone gate that can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: to Fortified Gate (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26186:
Build Palisade Gate (‹cost›)
Fragile wooden gate that can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26428:
Create Armored Elephant (‹cost›)
Anti-building Siege Cavalry. Resistant to most ranged attacks. Exceptionally strong vs. buildings. Weak vs. Spearman-line. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks from distance.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); attack (University); speed, HP (Stable); to Siege Elephant (Siege Workshop); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›

Research Town Watch (‹cost›)
Buildings +4 line of sight.
28012:
Research Crop Rotation (‹cost›)
New Farms provide +175 food.
28013:
Research Heavy Plow (‹cost›)
New Farms provide +125 food. Farmers +1 carry capacity.
28014:

New Farms provide +75 food.

Market trading fee reduced to 15%.
28017:
Research Banking (‹cost›)
Tributes to other players are free.
28022:
Research Loom (‹cost›)
Villagers +15 HP and +1 melee/+2 pierce armor.
28023:
Research Coinage (‹cost›)
Tributes to other players cost only 20%.
28045:
Research Faith (‹cost›)
Units are 50% harder for enemy Monks to convert.
28047:
Research Flaming Arrows (‹cost›)
Foot Archers, Skirmishers, Mounted Archers, ranged Warships, and ranged Fortifications +1 attack. Required for
Gastraphetoros, Leviathan.
28050:
Research Masonry (‹cost›)
Buildings +10% HP, +1 melee/+1 pierce armor and +3 building armor.
28051:
Research Architecture (‹cost›)
Buildings +10% HP, +1 melee/+1 pierce armor and +3 building armor.
28054:
Research Treadmill Crane (‹cost›)
Villagers construct buildings +20% faster.
28055:
Research Gold Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather gold +15% faster.
28063:
Upgrade to Keep (‹cost›)
Upgrades Guard Towers to Keeps, which are stronger.
28068:
Research Iron Casting (‹cost›)
Infantry and Cavalry +1 attack.
28074:
Research Scale Mail Armor (‹cost›)
Infantry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28075:
Research Blast Furnace (‹cost›)
Infantry and Cavalry +2 attack.
28076:
Research Chain Mail Armor (‹cost›)
Infantry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28077:

Research Plate Barding Armor (‹cost›)

28081:

28082:
Research Chain Barding Armor (‹cost›)
Cavalry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28090:
Research Tracking (‹cost›)
Infantry have +2 line of sight so they see enemy units from a longer distance.
28093:
Research Ballistics (‹cost›)
Foot Archers, Skirmishers, Mounted Archers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications and some Siege Weapons fire more accurately at moving targets.
28101:
Advance to Civic Age (‹cost›; two Archaic Age buildings)
Improves your civilization. Gives you access to different buildings, more powerful military units, and stronger technologies. Before you can advance, you must have any two Archaic Age buildings: Lumber Camp, Mining Camp, Mill, Port, or Barracks.
28102: Advance to Classical Age (‹cost›; two Civic Age buildings)
28103: Advance to Imperial Age (‹cost›; two Classical Age buildings or a Fort)
28150:
Research Bodkin Arrow (‹cost›)
Archery Units, Skirmishers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications +1 attack, +1 range; Town Centers +1 attack.
28151:
Research Bracer (‹cost›)
Archery Units, Skirmishers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications +1 attack, +1 range; Town Centers +1 attack.
28163:
Upgrade to Fortified Wall (‹cost›)
Upgrades Stone Walls and Stone Gates to Fortified Walls and Gates, which are stronger.
28172:
Research Fletching (‹cost›)
Archery Units, Skirmishers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications +1 attack, +1 range; Town Centers +1 attack.

Research Gold Shaft Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather gold +15% faster.
28186:

28190:

28209:
Research Leather Archer Armor (‹cost›)
Ranged Soldiers +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28211:
Research Wheelbarrow (‹cost›)

Research Ring Archer Armor (‹cost›)

28220:
Research Illumination (‹cost›)

28222:

Monastery Units +3 conversion range.
28231:
Research Two-Man Saw (‹cost›)
Villagers gather wood +10% faster.
28246:
Research Hand Cart (‹cost›)
Villagers +50% carry capacity and move +10% faster.
28276:
Research Stone Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather stone +15% faster.
28277:
Research Stone Shaft Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather stone +15% faster.
28278:
Research Arrowslits (‹cost›)
Watch Towers +1, Guard Towers +2, Keeps and Donjons +3 attack.
28282:
Research Town Patrol (‹cost›)
Buildings +4 line of sight.
28315:
Research Redemption (‹cost›)
Monks can convert enemy Siege Weapons and buildings (except Town Centers, Castles, Monasteries, Farms, Fish Traps, Walls, Gates, and Wonders). Monks can convert most enemy units from a distance, but they must stand adjacent to buildings, rams, and Trebuchets to convert them.
28316:
Research Atonement (‹cost›)
Monks can convert enemy Monastery Units.
28319:
Research Conscription (‹cost›)
Military buildings (except Siege Workshops) work +33% faster.
28321:
Research Murder Holes (‹cost›)
Removes minimum range of Fortifications so they can attack enemies at their base.
28374:
Research Heated Shot (‹cost›)
Towers +125% attack vs. ships; Castles +25% attack vs. ships.
28376:
Research Hoardings (‹cost›)
Castles, Kreposts and Donjons +1,000 HP.
28378:
Research Siege Engineers (‹cost›)
Ranged Siege Weapons and Siege Warships +1 range. All Siege Weapons and Siege Warships +20% attack vs. buildings; Demolition Units +40% attack vs. buildings.
28408:
Research Spies/Treason (Cost: ‹static_cost=Gold,200› per enemy Villager for Spies/‹static_cost=Gold,400› per use for Treason)
Spies (Random Map games) reveals all enemy units and buildings by showing you their line of sight. The total cost is 200 gold per each Villager from other players; allied Villagers are excluded when teams are locked.

Treason (Regicide games) reveals the position of all enemy Kings to your team for a few seconds. The Kings appear on the mini-map as a flashing X. Each time you choose Treason, 400 gold is immediately deducted from your stockpile.
28411:
Research Thumb Ring (‹cost›)
Archery Units attack +15% faster. Archery Units and Skirmishers fire with 100% accuracy.
28412:
Research Heresy (‹cost›)
Units converted by an enemy Monk die instead of changing to the enemy's color.
28415:
Research Parthian Tactics (‹cost›)
Mounted Archers +1 melee/+2 pierce armor; +2 attack vs. Spearman-line.
28416:
Research Theocracy (‹cost›)
If a group of Monks converts an enemy unit, only one of the Monks must rest afterward.
28435:
Research Herbal Medicine (‹cost›)
Units garrisoned in buildings heal +500% faster.
120195:
Archer and Cavalry civilization

• Shipyards work 15% faster
• Town Centers can be individually upgraded to be more powerful starting in the Civic Age
• Stable technologies research 50% faster

Unique Units:
Immortal (Infantry/Archer)

Unique Techs:
• Sparabaras (Immortals and Spearmen +2/+1 armor)
• Reed Arrows (Archers, ranged Immortals, and Galleys fire 25% faster)
• Scythed Chariots (War Chariots have increased trample radius)
• Sagaris (Cavalry deal +2 unblockable damage vs. units)

Team Bonus:
Houses are built 100% faster
120196:
Infantry and Naval civilization

• Policy style can be changed between Economic, Naval, and Military at the Town Center
• Changing Policy becomes progressively more expensive, up to a maximum of 50 gold
• Lumberjacks slowly generate food
• Hoplites move 15% faster

Unique Units:
Strategos (Infantry)

Unique Techs:
• Taxiarchs (Strategoi give an additional +1 attack to nearby melee units, and their aura is 33% larger)
• Trierarchies (Monoreme-line charge attack deals additional area damage and recharges faster)
• Eisphora (50% of the Hoplite gold cost is replaced with an additional food cost)
• Delian League (Ports and Shipyards make nearby Warships attack 15% faster)

Team Bonus:
Shipyard technologies research 50% faster
120197:
Infantry civilization

• A Polemarch is created for free in both the Civic Age and Classical Age
• Villagers and Fishing Ships drop off 10% more food
• Elite Hoplite available in the Classical Age

Unique Units:
Polemarch (Infantry), Hippeus (Infantry)

Unique Techs:
• Helot Levies (Spearmen, Skirmishers, and Villagers train 50% faster)
• Xyphos (Hoplites and Monoremes +1 attack for every 5 nearby enemy military units [max +3])
• Agoge (Hoplites can receive an additional +1/+1 armor near other Hoplites)
• Peloponnesian League (Monoreme-line +5 attack vs Galleys and Forts slowly generate gold)

Team Bonus:
Barracks technologies research 50% faster
120203:
Infantry and Cavalry civilization

• Take 10% less damage from enemies on higher elevation
• Recruitment Doctrines are available at the Barracks, Archery Range, and Stable
• Infantry armor upgrades apply to cavalry
• Siege Weapons have +1 pierce armor and +30% damage against buildings

Unique Units:
Companion Cavalry (Cavalry), Phalangite (Infantry)

Unique Techs:
• Veteran Chiliarchs (Recruitment Doctrines become 33% more effective)
• Ends of the World (Fortified Outposts receive greater aura bonuses and improved stats)
• Pezhetairoi (Phalangite minimum range halved)
• Sarissophoroi (Companion Cavalry gain a speed charge attack)

Team Bonus:
Outposts can be individually upgraded into Fortified Outposts
120204:
Infantry civilization

• Elite Skirmisher upgrade is free
• Skirmishers regenerate 5/10 HP per minute in Civic/Classical Age
• Battle Drills is available in the Classical Age
• All buildings except Town Centers can be built on any elevation
• Forts and Towers increase the workrate of nearby Miners and Lumberjacks, and serve as resource dropsites
• Shepherds and Hunters slowly generate gold while gathering from animals

Unique Units:
Rhomphaia Warrior (Infantry)

Unique Techs:
• Odomantian Raiders (Infantry and cavalry gain gold from killing enemies)
• Dii Plunderers (Spearman-line, Levy/Hoplite-line, and Rhomphaia Warriors gain wood/food/gold respectively from damaging enemy buildings)
• Bessian Metalworking (Levy line, Lancer line, and Rhomphaia Warriors strip armour from targets when attacking)
• Peltasts (Skirmishers deal pass-through damage)

Team Bonus:
Buildings have +3 line of sight
120205:
Archer and Elephant civilization

• Villagers gathering from Stone slowly gain food
• Stone mines last 30% longer
• Villagers and Fishing Ships gather from Oysters 15% faster
• Stable units heal 25 HP per minute when no enemies are nearby (Starting in Classical Age)
• Lemboi cost -10% and receive +1 attack per age, starting in Civic Age

Unique Units:
Pattiyodha Longbowman (Archer), Sannāhya (Cavalry)

Unique Techs:
• Vadhāvadha (Sannāhyas have improved trample damage)
• Leaf-Headed Shafts (Pattiyodha Longbowman point-blank range damage improved)
• Vedic Teachings (Each technology researched at the Academy increases villager work rate by 2% [max 20%])
• Skandhavaras (Forts can be individually upgraded with Emplacements)

Team Bonus:
Trade Carts move 15% faster

Upgrades: armor, speed, cost, capacity (Port); more resistant to Priestesses (Temple).‹DEFAULT›

426064:
Create Priestess (‹cost›)
Converts enemy units to your civilization. Heals friendly units (except ships and siege weapons). Strong vs. slow and non-ranged units. Weak vs. Scout Cavalry-line, Eagle Warriors and Ranged Soldiers. Can collect Relics and bring them to Temples.
Upgrades: at Temple.‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
426065:
Build Fort (‹cost›)
Used to train and upgrade your Unique Unit, build Palintonons, and research technologies. Automatically attacks enemies within range. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers provide additional projectiles. Provides 20 population. Cannot be converted by enemy Priestesses.
Upgrades: production speed (Fort); line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor, accuracy (Academy); attack, range (Blacksmith); attack, range (Fort).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›

428005:
Research Sparabaras (‹cost›)
Immortals and Spearmen +2/+1 armor. Disables Reed Arrows upon being researched.
428006:
Research Reed Arrows (‹cost›)
Archers, ranged Immortals, and Galleys fire 25% faster. Disables Sparabaras upon being researched.
428007:
Research Scythed Chariots (‹cost›)
War Chariots gain increased trample radius. Disables Sagaris upon being researched.
428008:
Research Sagaris (‹cost›)
Cavalry +2 unblockable damage against units. Disables Scythed Chariots upon being researched.
428009:
Research Taxiarchs (‹cost›)
Strategoi give an additional +1 attack to nearby melee units, and their aura becomes 33% larger. Disables Trierarchies upon being researched.
428010:
Research Trierarchies (‹cost›)
Monoreme-line charge attack deals additional area damage and recharges faster. Disables Taxiarchs upon being researched.
428011:
Research Eisphora (‹cost›)
50% of the Hoplite gold cost is replaced with an additional food cost. Disables Delian League upon being researched.
428012:
Research Delian League (‹cost›)
Ports and Shipyards make nearby Warships attack 15% faster. Disables Eisphora upon being researched.
428013:
Research Helot Levies (‹cost›)
Spearmen, Skirmishers, and Villagers train 50% faster. Disables Xyphos upon being researched.
428014:
Research Agoge (‹cost›)
Hoplites can receive an additional +1/+1 armor when near other Hoplites. Disables Peloponnesian League upon being researched.
428015:
Research Xyphos (‹cost›)
Hoplites and Monoreme-line +1 attack for every 5 nearby enemy military units (max +3). Disables Helot Levies upon being researched.
428016:
Research Peloponnesian League (‹cost›)
Monoreme-line +5 attack against Galleys, and Forts generate gold. Disables Agoge upon being researched.
428028:
Research Scoop Nets (‹cost›)
Fishing Ships gather 15% faster and carry +10 resources.
428029:
Research Drums (‹cost›)
Ships (except Incendiary Ships) move 15% faster.
428031:
Research Shipwright (‹cost›)
Ships cost 20% less wood; build 35% faster.
428033:
Research Battle Drills (‹cost›)
Levy-line receive +3 attack, +1 vs standard buildings, +2 vs Shock Infantry, and +1 line of sight.
428045:
Research Economic Town Center (‹cost›)
Upgrades this Town Center to an Economic Town Center, making all nearby Villagers gather 10% faster.
428046:
Research Military Town Center (‹cost›)
Upgrades this Town Center to a Military Town Center, healing nearby military units and making them move 15% faster.
428047:
Research Defensive Town Center (‹cost›)
Upgrades this Town Center to a Defensive Town Center, increasing its durability and firepower, and making all nearby units attack 15% faster.
428051:
Change Current Policy to Economic Policy (‹cost›)
Lumberjacks gather food from trees 50% faster.
428052:
Change Current Policy to Naval Policy (‹cost›)
Foot Archers and Warships 20% less gold.
428053:
Change Current Policy to Military Policy (‹cost›)
Military production buildings cost 33% less wood, and melee military units gain gold for killing units.
428054:
Research Ephorate (‹cost›)
Polemarch make nearby soldiers regenerate HP; Disables Morai upon being researched.
428055:
Research Morai (‹cost›)
Polemarch aura radius increased and also make nearby military units move 15% faster; Disables Ephorate upon being researched.
428056:
Research Skeuophoroi (‹cost›)
Polemarchs +2 attack and receive a shield against projectiles.
428141:
Research Veteran Chiliarchs (‹cost›)
Recruitment Doctrines become 33% more effective. Disables Ends of the World upon being researched.
428142:
Research Ends of the World (‹cost›)
Fortified Outposts heal nearby units. Disables Veteran Chiliarchs upon being researched.
428143:
Research Pezhetairoi (‹cost›)
Phalangite minimum attack range decreases by half. Disables Sarissophoroi upon being researched.
428144:
Research Sarissophoroi (‹cost›)
Companion Cavalry gain a speed charge attack. Disables Pezhetairoi upon being researched.
428145:
Research Odomantian Raiders (‹cost›)

428146:
Research Dii Plunderers (‹cost›)

428147:

Levy line, Lancer line, and Rhomphaia Warriors strip armour from targets when attacking. Disables Peltasts upon being researched.
428148:
Research Peltasts (‹cost›)
Skirmisher projectiles damage all units they pass through. Disables Bessian Metalworking upon being researched.

428150:

428151:
